metadata.title: CVE-2022-24805 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
net-snmp: A buffer overflow in the handling of the INDEX ofNET-SNMP-VACM-MIB can cause an out-of-bounds memory access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-24805` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsnmp-base - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.3+esm3
libsnmp-perl - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.3+esm3
libsnmp30 - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.3+esm3
python-netsnmp - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.3+esm3
snmp - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.3+esm3
snmpd - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.3+esm3
tkmib - 5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.3+esm3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: net-snmp package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.2~dfsg-8.1ubuntu3.3+esm3').
